properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 1 at 8:28AM PST until February 2 at 7:27AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County


The second round of heavy rain has moved into the Olympics earlier
this morning with two to three inches reported in the last twelve
hours ending at 8 am. The heavy rain has moved south through the
area as of this time.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Satsop River Near Satsop
* from this morning to Sunday morning.
* At  8:15 AM Saturday the stage was 37.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 38.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 12 PM
Saturday and crest near 38.2 feet around 4 PM Saturday. The river
will fall below flood stage tonight.
* Impact...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands
and some roads along the river.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
